Spanish: Él tiene un hijo y dos hijas.

English: It's a whole number.
Spanish: Es un número entero.

English: I've been living in Boston for nearly three years.
Spanish: Llevo viviendo en Boston cerca de tres años.

English: There are pretty flowers in the garden.
Spanish: Hay bonitas flores en el jardín.

English: Something seems to be wrong with my computer.
Spanish: Parece que algo va mal con mi ordenador.

English: He went hunting in the woods.
Spanish: Él fue a cazar en el bosque.

English: I'm afraid you'll have to go in person.
Spanish: Me preocupa que tengas que ir en persona.

English: Did you get there on time?
Spanish: ¿Llegaste ahí a tiempo?

English: I've got something for Tom.
Spanish: Tengo algo para Tom.

English: I think it's time for me to buy a house.
Spanish: Creo que es hora de que me compre una casa.

English: I play tennis, golf and volleyball.
Spanish: Juego al tenis, al golf y al voleibol.

English: Do a little work! You'll lose some weight.
Spanish: ¡Trabaja un poco! Te servirá para adelgazar.

English: Six months have passed since the author was killed in an accident.
Spanish: Han pasado seis meses desde que el autor murió en un accidente.

English: The bell had already rung when I got to school.
Spanish: Ya había sonado la campana cuando llegué al colegio.

English: I saw everyone was already there waiting for me.
Spanish: Vi que todos ya estaban ahí esperándome.

English: I can't tell you the answer to that yet.
Spanish: Aún no puedo decirte la respuesta a eso.

English: We're not the only Canadians here.
Spanish: No somos los únicos canadienses aquí.

English: Everyone saw it.
Spanish: Todo el mundo lo vio.

English: Are you happy?
Spanish: ¿Eres feliz?

English: I was born in Boston.
Spanish: Nací en Boston.

English: You don't have to hurry.
Spanish: No tienes que darte prisa.

English: You're not my girlfriend anymore.
Spanish: No sos más mi novia.

English: That's nothing new.
Spanish: Eso no es nada nuevo.

English: No one's been here.
Spanish: Nadie ha estado aquí.

English: Are you bored?
Spanish: ¿Estás aburrido?

English: If you're tired, go to bed.
Spanish: Si estás cansada, vete a la cama.

English: I got something for Tom.
Spanish: Tengo algo para Tom.

English: I live here now.
Spanish: Ahora vivo aquí.

English: I thought Tom would be different.
Spanish: Creía que Tom sería diferente.

English: I have never fed my dog a banana.
Spanish: Nunca le he dado un plátano de comer a mi perro.

English: Don't do it, Tom.
Spanish: No lo hagas, Tom.

English: She divided the cake into five pieces.
Spanish: Ella dividió la tarta en cinco partes.

English: We were both pretty busy at that time.
Spanish: Ambos estábamos muy ocupados en ese momento.

English: He is more lucky than clever.
Spanish: Él es más suertudo que astuto.

English: How does that make you feel?
Spanish: ¿Cómo te hace sentir eso?
